duck: Parts-per notation - In science and engineering, the parts-per notation is a set of pseudo units to describe small values of miscellaneous dimensionless quantities, e.g. mole fraction or mass fraction.

Golden ratio - In mathematics and the arts, two quantities are in the golden ratio if the ratio of the sum of the quantities to the larger quantity is equal to the ratio of the larger quantity to the smaller one.
Aspect ratio - The aspect ratio is the ratio of the width of a shape to its height when the width is larger than the height, i.e. the shape is positioned as a "landscape" rather than "portrait".
Interval (music) - In music theory, an interval is the difference between two pitches.
ratio definition: the indicated quotient of two mathematical expressions.
Fraction (mathematics) - A fraction (from Latin: fractus, "broken") represents a part of a whole or, more generally, any number of equal parts.
In mathematics, a ratio is a relationship between two numbers of the same kind (e.g.

In mathematics, a 'ratio' is a relationship between two numbers of the same
kind<ref>Wentworth, p. 55</ref> (e.g., objects, persons, students, spoonfuls,
units of whatever identical dimension), usually expressed as "a to b" or a:b,
sometimes expressed arithmetically as a dimensionless quotient of the
two<ref>New International Encyclopedia</ref> that explicitly indicates how many
times the first number contains the second (not necessarily an
integer).<ref>Penny Cyclopedia, p. 307</ref>

In layman's terms a ratio represents, for every amount of one thing, how much
there is of another thing. For example, supposing one has 8 oranges and 6 lemons
in a bowl of fruit, the ratio of oranges to lemons would be 4:3 (which is
equivalent to 8:6) while the ratio of lemons to oranges would be 3:4.
Additionally, the ratio of oranges to the total amount of fruit is 4:7
(equivalent to 8:14). The 4:7 ratio can be further converted to a fraction of
4/7 to represent how much of the fruit is oranges.
